top_stories.title: How to design an actually good flash flood alert system
top_stories.description: Flash floods have wrought more havoc in the US this week, from the Northeast to the Midwest, just weeks after swollen rivers took more than 130 lives across central Texas earlier this month. Frustrations have grown in the aftermath of that catastrophe over why more wasn't done to warn people in advance. Local officials face […]
top_stories.author: Justine Calma

top_stories.title: This cargo ship is turning its CO2 emissions into green cement
top_stories.description: A giant cargo ship is set to trap carbon from its exhaust and turn it into cement for use in onshore construction. The technology, developed by UK startup Seabound, is billed as the world’s first commercial carbon capture system for boats. It will be installed on the UBC Cork, a cement carrier owned by Germany’s Hartmann Group. “These are the systems we intend to scale across hundreds, and eventually thousands, of vessels,” Alisha Frediksson, Seabound’s CEO and co-founder, told TNW. “We’re...
top_stories.author: Siôn Geschwindt

top_stories.title: Elastic and Tencent Cloud AI search technology make Dunhuang Digital Scripture Cave accessible to everyone
top_stories.description: Ancient books in the Dunhuang Digital Scripture Cave have now become accessible to everyone online. The Dunhuang Research Institute officially released the Digital Scripture Cave database, including more than 9,900 volumes of Dunhuang documents and more than 60,700 images that contain Buddhist scriptures, legal codes, contracts, silk paintings, and more.With the help of Elastic and Tencent Cloud AI search and large language model (LLM) technology, traditional Chinese and rare characters in...
